feat: onProgressiveAt method to switch on the light progressively at a given time

In the morning you don't want to be awaken by a 255 luminosity straight in your face.

A progressive switch on is way more pleasant :
onProgressiveAt(fromLum, toLum, time, pHours, pMinutes, pRepeat = false)

This closes #12

commit_list.message:
feat: Launch git command inside code instead of having shell in npm start command

Before :
```
"scripts": {
  "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1",
  "start": "git --no-pager log --pretty=oneline > ./git-log.txt && node ./index.js > ./release-notes.txt && rm -f ./git-log.txt"
},
```

After :
```
"scripts": {
  "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1",
  "start": "node ./index.js > ./release-notes.txt"
},
```

This also avoid to dump git log result in a txt file.

This closes #7

commit_list.message:
fix: Use Observable to keep the history up to date in real time

- Change promises to read history in for Observables with rxjs
The view is now updated as soon as a link is streamed (or fail)
Good article here : https://coryrylan.com/blog/angular-2-observable-data-services

- Remove *providers* (I thought providers were a way to enumerate services but in fact it just creates a new service and the app can't share data as it should

commit_list.message:
fix: Gulp watch throws an error because of empty src

When running `gulp build serve` everything is fine for the first compilation, but as soon as a file gets changed, gulp throws an error.

It's due to https://github.com/maxime1992/real-debrid-stream/commit/6fa3c0f7d95ffd1e746bc3f7c1343789de6ca5af (https://github.com/maxime1992/real-debrid-stream/issues/13). Changing the required parameters of *ts function* (now expects the configuration object + the source file(s) `function ts(root, src)`) broke this line :
`gulp.watch('src/scripts/**/*.{ts,css,html}', gulp.series(ts, 'unit'));` (ts has no parameter and gulp.src doesn't like that).

This closes #16 and fixes #16 bug

commit_list.message:
chore: setup tslint-language-service to improve IDE perfs on Visual Studio Code

With this commit, you should disable `vscode-tslint` extension (at least for the workspace) as it triggers Typescript checks twice (one for compilation, the other for checking). This tslint-language-service plugin shares the program representation with TypeScript which is faster.

More information here: https://github.com/angelozerr/tslint-language-service

Warning: This might introduce a small bug on Windows machine, see tsconfig.json comment

commit_list.message:
feat: Gzip html, css, js and json files

Improve overall speed of the app by gziping every html, css, js and json files.

The web-template cannot do that on his own, you'll have to tell your server that it can deliver content already gziped. Here's an idea how to do that with NodeJS : https://www.npmjs.com/package/connect-gzip-static

This commit will just ADD gz files. It won't delete all the "normal" ones.
This way, you can also serve basic files to older browsers.

This closes #32

fix: Update the doc and remove useless dependency

This closes #66

fix: Some files have bad carriage return

Those 4 files :
src/fonts/Roboto-Bold.ttf
src/fonts/Roboto-Light.ttf
src/fonts/Roboto-Thin.ttf
src/images/angular2-seed-logo.png

have carriage return defined for windows and git wants to convert them.
It is also a problem with rebase (blocked).
git reset --hard HEAD doesn't do anything (???)

This closes #68

fix: Karma needs to have plugins defined

PhantomJS2 can also be changed to PhantomJS in karma.conf

This closes #66

fix: Remove gulp-recess module

This module is useless since we use scss.
doc: Remove useless part from readme.md

fix: Remove respond.js

Respond.js is for IE 6-8 but Angular 2 only supports IE 9+.

Closes ghpabs/angular2-seed#19
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/develop' into develop
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/develop' into develop

feat: Add scss linting

Use gulp-sass-lint module instead of gulp-scss-lint because it has no dependies to setup.

gulp-scss-lint is using ruby and scss_lint.

Closes ghpabs/angular2-seed#12
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/develop' into develop

refactor: Flatten assets folder

Remove assets folder to have the following structure :
src/
   |_ app/
   |_ sass/
   |_ index.html

img folder should arrive soon.

doc: Explain how to change browser for test

It's possible to use many browser for the tests.
As angular2 needs phantomjs2 instead of phantomjs, it's important to let users know
about it.
Tests are running fine in chrome, that's why it's the default browser for now.
It might change as soon as phantomjs2 may be installed in an easier way.

commit_list.message:
chore: setup tslint-language-service to improve IDE perfs on Visual Studio Code

With this commit, you should disable `vscode-tslint` extension (at least for the workspace) as it triggers Typescript checks twice (one for compilation, the other for checking). This tslint-language-service plugin shares the program representation with TypeScript which is faster.

More information here: https://github.com/angelozerr/tslint-language-service

Warning: This might introduce a small bug on Windows machine, see tsconfig.json comment

perf: In selector use pizza IDs with maps instead of searching them with filter

Before the perf refactor, pizzas had an ID of pizzaCategory. Now we do have the categories with pizzas IDs.
It's way more powerful as we don't iterate over every pizza as many time as we have categories with a filter.
